item.title: Houston, Weâ€™ve Got A 4G Solution
item.description: Are you satisfied with your current internet service, or does it feel slow, unreliable, and overpriced? Many people struggle with limited broadband access. Residents of Houston, Texas, and surrounding areas like The Woodlands and Pasadena now have a new option: CLEAR, a 4G wireless broadband service. Powered by Sprint and Clearwire’s WiMAX technology, you can check their coverage map to see if you’re eligible. Houston isn’t the only location with access to this 4G wireless broadband service.

item.title: Lit Buildings Expand Fiber Optic Bandwidth in Houston
item.description: Houston, Texas, the fourth largest city in the US, is a hub for various industries, including healthcare, energy, manufacturing, and aerospace. The city’s demand for high-speed internet, particularly fiber optic bandwidth, is constantly growing. To address this need, Alpheus Communications is expanding its fiber optic network to include key buildings in Houston’s business district. ](http://www.fibernetworkquotes.com/)What does a “lit building” mean? In this context, it refers to a building equipped with active fiber optic service.

item.title: Korean Air provides a direct flight between Seoul and Houston
item.description: Korean Air has launched new daily nonstop flights between George Bush Intercontinental Airport (IAH) in Houston and Incheon International Airport in Seoul. Source: Korean Air. The first 777-200 aircraft arrives in Houston on May 2. John Jackson, Korean Air’s Vice President of Passenger Marketing and Sales for the Americas, stated: “We see significant opportunities here and are both proud and excited to join Houston’s vibrant business community.” These nonstop flights will depart daily from Terminal D at George Bush Intercontinental Airport at 10:40 am CST, with return flights leaving Seoul at 9:10 am local time from Incheon International Airport.
